channel.title: So I herd u dislike Ruddkipz? (Kevin Rudd replaced by Gillard)
channel.description: Probably won't concern you if you're not from Australia, but Julia Gillard has won a vote for leadership of the Labor party and is now the current Prime Minister of Australia (and the first woman too.) Opinions, thoughts?

item.title: So I herd u dislike Ruddkipz? (Kevin Rudd replaced by Gillard)
item.dc:creator: Comrade_Tiki
item.description:
There there, don’t feel embarrassed.

[COLOR=‘Gray’]Unless you lived on Isle of Man.

Read full topic
item.source: So I herd u dislike Ruddkipz? (Kevin Rudd replaced by Gillard)

item.title: So I herd u dislike Ruddkipz? (Kevin Rudd replaced by Gillard)
item.dc:creator: loony636
item.description:
Door:

It’s not England; Wales, Scotland, Northern Ireland and the other territories haven’t been annexed by England, we’re a United Kingdom.

I feel embarrased since I lived in the UK for ~10 years.

Read full topic

item.title: So I herd u dislike Ruddkipz? (Kevin Rudd replaced by Gillard)
item.dc:creator: Geeba
item.description:
Wondered how long it would be before the Aussies got the hump with Rudd… Labour will leave you with record debt, immigration rife and free loaders giving up work to drink Stella all day because they’ll be better off not working! just like the UK! they’ve done it to us twice!

item.title: So I herd u dislike Ruddkipz? (Kevin Rudd replaced by Gillard)
item.dc:creator: Comrade_Tiki
item.description:
baconeggs:

Vote for the Communist Party for proper shenanigans.

Spread this sentiment. Spread it hard. If fomer-Labour votes red, and the standing Greens are likewise converted to vote red, you might just accomplish something statue-worthy.

Read full topic
item.source: So I herd u dislike Ruddkipz? (Kevin Rudd replaced by Gillard)

item.title: So I herd u dislike Ruddkipz? (Kevin Rudd replaced by Gillard)
item.dc:creator: loony636
item.description:
baconeggs:

Yeah, except Gillard is promising to continue those policies, which makes this whole changeover look pretty needless.

Well she said she was willing to relook at the asylum seekers policy, as well as the mining tax and the ETS (after the next election, of course), so that should be interesting.

But yes, on the whole I think the changeover is going to mean relatively little in the grand scheme of things.

Door:

No, Conservatives in a coalition government with the Liberals.
I may be basing this on something a bit to heavily…

I lol’d. We’re talking about Australia. You’re talking about England.

Read full topic
item.source: So I herd u dislike Ruddkipz? (Kevin Rudd replaced by Gillard)

item.source: So I herd u dislike Ruddkipz? (Kevin Rudd replaced by Gillard)

item.title: So I herd u dislike Ruddkipz? (Kevin Rudd replaced by Gillard)
item.dc:creator: loony636
item.description:
Well she’s the first female PM we’ve ever had, which is a good thing in and of itself.

This whole stunt means that the Labor party now has the chance to, in effect, begin again. They can scrap some of the more unpopular policies of Rudd’s government (i.e. the resource tax), without being seen as flip-flopping. I think it’ll lead to better policies, and a better chance of a victory at the next election.

Read full topic
item.source: So I herd u dislike Ruddkipz? (Kevin Rudd replaced by Gillard)
